title: cygan
author: cygan
created_time: November 06, 2022, 04:14:47 PMLast edit: November 21, 2023, 12:21:32 PM by cygan
content: in this thread i would like to see some pics of your stadium visits. no matter if it's football, rugby, basketball, american football, volleyball, cricket, baseball or even a nascar or formula 1 race - post your pics here (best with your profile name) which game you visitedthe idea came up yesterday at the bundesliga game werder bremen vs. schalke 04 (which ended 2-1 for werder) and so i'll start with that too Quote from: cygan on November 05, 2022, 05:06:34 PMlets go werder!!!    |User|Game/Season|Sport/Country|Stadium|Competition|Link to Post||cygan|Werder Bremen vs. Schalke 04 2022/23|Football/Germany|Weserstadium|1. Bundesliga|61244422||MinoRaiola|Eintracht Frankfurt vs. SSC Napoli 2022/23|Football/Germany|Waldstadium|Champions League|61799174||LDL|India vs. Bangladesh 2023|Cricket/India|Mirpur National Stadium|National Game|61802315||Trofo|Arsenal London vs. FC Southampton 2022/23|Football/England|Emirates Stadium|PL Game|62169487||CLS63|Turkey vs. Croatia 2023|Basketball/Turkey|Sinan Erdem Dome/Istanbul|Olympic Games 2024 Qualification|62725335||cygan|Werder Bremen vs. Union Berlin 2023/24|Football/Germany|Weserstadium|1. Bundesliga|63078174||MinoRaiola|Oktagon 49|Fighting/Germany|Lanxess Arena/Cologne|MMA|63189992||...|...|...|...|...|...||...|...|...|...|...|...||...|...|...|...|...|...|

comments.author: gantez
comments.body: This is going to be interesting thread to see and read. I have no picture yet . I think the profile name is somehow going to draw some back to post that way but the user account making the post may serve same purpose. It is good seeing the forum front page.

comments.author: QueenVera
comments.created_time: November 07, 2022, 06:29:12 AMLast edit: November 09, 2022, 08:20:13 AM by QueenVera
comments.body: Quote from: gantez on November 06, 2022, 04:29:09 PMThis is going to be interesting thread to see and read. I have no picture yet . I think the profile name is somehow going to draw some back to post that way but the user account making the post may serve same purpose. It is good seeing the forum front page.I'm feeling left out already. This thrend will really be an interesting and exciting one.The O.P has nice views and I love the fact that also sampled your campaign and also proud of it.I also want to see more of those pictures and I also hope the locations be included if possible.I also think it will be nice if it's not just the physical presence visit to a stadium pictures are require but also pictures of how you're watching a current match.For example, one might be privileged to be at the stadium to post a picture of the stadium for us to see while the other might be streaming same match from a device which doesn't actually make a difference and the both should be allowed and permitted to show where there are watching it from as well.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: QueenVera on November 07, 2022, 06:29:12 AMQuote from: gantez on November 06, 2022, 04:29:09 PMThis is going to be interesting thread to see and read. I have no picture yet . I think the profile name is somehow going to draw some back to post that way but the user account making the post may serve same purpose. It is good seeing the forum front page.I'm feeling left out already. This thrend will really be an interesting and exciting one.The O.P has nice views and I love the fact that also sampled your campaign and also proud of it.I also want to see more of those pictures and I also hope the locations be included if possible I think it would be much better if OP have made it inline with gambling or made it related into it. I do get the idea; sportsbetting and watching the game on on live but if it is not directly for this section, things won't work out as planned even if the motive is good.Also many gamblers,nowadays, are just into online gambling. I think it is only on sports and esports betting wherein people are note solely for the profit from which team they brt for, but also for personal enjoyment. If OP made bet on that game, attaching his/her bet with those pictures he captured would more make this topic lively and more relevant. But I do like the idea still of actually watching the game than just making online bets and waiting for the result. Would try this one as well since I am into sports gambling.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Nice thread and nice initiative.I live from many years in Western Balkans moving from country to country in such zone but I hope I will visit the stadium one of these weeks and make sure to update here.Of course the stadiums here are mostly empty compared to Werder Bremen or any other major league in Europe because people are not as much football lovers as they are in Western Europe.The good thing is that UEFA has created Europe Conference League which hopefully will bring more love to these small teams.

Would try this one as well since I am into sports gambling.and that is exactly the intention behind this thread i hope that soon other users here will post some pics of their visited games

comments.author: darxiaomi
comments.body: Good thread Cygan. Here (argentina) the football ends until the next year. We can see some Bitcointalkers in the World Cup?Its gonna be interesting and as i said in the other thread, can be funny if you find other Bticointalker in a stadium.

comments.author: BITCOIN4X
comments.created_time: November 07, 2022, 09:16:59 PMLast edit: November 08, 2022, 08:29:57 PM by BITCOIN4X
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on November 07, 2022, 02:33:34 PMi hope that soon other users here will post some pics of their visited games Is this thread for visiting only, how about watching on tv with friends, streaming in room or anywhere else?I haven't been able to go to Europe to watch a game of my team live, but I really want to experience what the stadium atmosphere is like when a big game is played. But anyway, this thread will be interesting for some users watching live.Here at 4 am, I'm waiting for the second half of the Vallecano vs Real Madrid match. This is just a screenshot of my phone when I want to watch a match while being active on the forum. LOLCode:[img width=500]https://i.imgur.com/d7rivU1.jpg[/img]

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: Quote from: darxiaomi on November 07, 2022, 09:06:06 PMGood thread Cygan. Here (argentina) the football ends until the next year. ✂then you still have enough possibilities to send us some stadium pics  ... the south american supporters are even more fanatic than the ones here in europe Quote from: BITCOIN4X on November 07, 2022, 09:16:59 PM✂Is this thread for visiting only, how about watching on tv with friends, streaming in room or anywhere else?✂you have understood correctly, only pictures of stadium visits are allowed because otherwise the thread would be spammed with countless tv pictures

comments.author: BITCOIN4X
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on November 08, 2022, 07:57:41 AMyou have understood correctly, only pictures of stadium visits are allowed because otherwise the thread would be spammed with countless tv pictures Hahaha, I understand mate. So I'm going to edit it now though I'm really having fun with your idea.To be honest, I never know what I will get in the future. I want to watch the match live from the stadium of one of my favorite teams, it would be an unfulfilled dream without good financial support. No rant, this is just a wish. LOL

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: wanted to remind you guys again this thread maybe a forum user is at the world championship and could upload some stadium pics

comments.author: MinoRaiola
comments.created_time: February 21, 2023, 11:31:43 PMLast edit: February 22, 2023, 12:17:53 AM by MinoRaiola
comments.body: Frankfurt - SSC Neapel 0:2Next time with a profile picture, I didn't think about that. The game today was not so good, I would have preferred to see Liverpool against Real Madrid. In Frankfurt no problems with the fans outside and inside the stadium. 47,500 fans were today there.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: This is a great idea for a thread.  I've got some more recent stadium visits ill share, but in honor of the ending of the NFL season, here's a couple cool pictures from some of the more fun games I've been too. The first one here is a Soldier Field in Chicago.  This was back in I want to say 2009 when Tom Brady and the Patriots were facing off against my Bears.  Brady lit it up in the epic snow game.  The picture doesn't do all the snow and how crazy it was justice.  Brady lit Gronk up this evening, and I believe Gronk had two TDs ( I also think it was his rookie season).  The other photo is of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers stadium in Tampa from a couple years ago.

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: I think most people on this forum might not want to participate in this, because it might be used to dox them. The brilliant aspect of this forum are people's pseudo anonymity and their freedom to talk without having any reservations that they would be targeted in their personal capacity.  So, you might need to change the approach to this request... and say that people can add any picture of a stadium, without posting pictures of themselves.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on February 22, 2023, 06:10:34 AMI think most people on this forum might not want to participate in this, because it might be used to dox them. The brilliant aspect of this forum are people's pseudo anonymity and their freedom to talk without having any reservations that they would be targeted in their personal capacity.  So, you might need to change the approach to this request... and say that people can add any picture of a stadium, without posting pictures of themselves.  I don't think it will harm their privacy because you don't need to post you at the stadium, but it could be you holding a piece of paper with your username. If you're not comfortable you can just post like 2 users above. I'm not sure what's the punishment if someone post a picture of someone post and claiming if that picture was captured by themselves.

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: i don't see any problems if someone takes stadium pictures with his username/profile, which then also shows us that the user was actually in the stadium.the probability is rather low that at this moment of the photo shooting someone is standing at the side, who recognizes the forum or your profile and knows what it's all about@MinoRaiola @ChiBitCTy nice photos of both of you. too bad you didn't see a home win for frankfurt.... but napoli is currently very strong and has a very good run. but just to hear the cl anthem in the stadium is already an experience (i know what I'm talking about).

comments.author: MinoRaiola
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on February 22, 2023, 09:02:32 AMi don't see any problems if someone takes stadium pictures with his username/profile, which then also shows us that the user was actually in the stadium.the probability is rather low that at this moment of the photo shooting someone is standing at the side, who recognizes the forum or your profile and knows what it's all about@MinoRaiola @ChiBitCTy nice photos of both of you. too bad you didn't see a home win for frankfurt.... but napoli is currently very strong and has a very good run. but just to hear the cl anthem in the stadium is already an experience (i know what I'm talking about).Many should feel free and not be afraid. But it's okay if someone doesn't want to do it. But if people are do it and possibly even together at an event and have fun, why not. I have also met a few users, or one has talked more privately - not only about crypto. Sometimes it can go a step further if you know what you are getting into.Frankfurt play really bad and i thought Napoli would win it, they are just too strong. Ii Italy they will not make it, I think the journey of Frankfurt is over in the Champions League.

comments.author: virasisog
comments.body: Quote from: MinoRaiola on February 22, 2023, 11:20:41 AMQuote from: cygan on February 22, 2023, 09:02:32 AMi don't see any problems if someone takes stadium pictures with his username/profile, which then also shows us that the user was actually in the stadium.the probability is rather low that at this moment of the photo shooting someone is standing at the side, who recognizes the forum or your profile and knows what it's all about@MinoRaiola @ChiBitCTy nice photos of both of you. too bad you didn't see a home win for frankfurt.... but napoli is currently very strong and has a very good run. but just to hear the cl anthem in the stadium is already an experience (i know what I'm talking about).Many should feel free and not be afraid. But it's okay if someone doesn't want to do it. But if people are do it and possibly even together at an event and have fun, why not. I have also met a few users, or one has talked more privately - not only about crypto. Sometimes it can go a step further if you know what you are getting into.Frankfurt play really bad and i thought Napoli would win it, they are just too strong. Ii Italy they will not make it, I think the journey of Frankfurt is over in the Champions League.There are just people who always prefer anonymity and privacy for their own valied reasons. For some of us, it's fun o attend sports events and take photoes with our friends and loved ones because that's also a collection of good memories.Unfortunately, I have just been watching sports through the internet and television these past few years. Maybe I was used to it because of the pandemic.

comments.author: LDL
comments.body: Football is not popular in my country but cricket is very popular sport in my country. Some days ago I went to Mirpur National Stadium to watch the India vs Bangladesh ODI cricket match. This is the biggest and most popular stadium in my country. I took some pictures and will share them with you. Happily Bangladesh beat India by 5 runs that day.Shere Bangla National Stadium, Dhaka, Bangladesh

comments.author: TheGreatPython
comments.body: Quote from: Plaguedeath on February 22, 2023, 07:40:11 AMQuote from: Kakmakr on February 22, 2023, 06:10:34 AMI think most people on this forum might not want to participate in this, because it might be used to dox them. The brilliant aspect of this forum are people's pseudo anonymity and their freedom to talk without having any reservations that they would be targeted in their personal capacity.  So, you might need to change the approach to this request... and say that people can add any picture of a stadium, without posting pictures of themselves.  I don't think it will harm their privacy because you don't need to post you at the stadium, but it could be you holding a piece of paper with your username. If you're not comfortable you can just post like 2 users above. I'm not sure what's the punishment if someone post a picture of someone post and claiming if that picture was captured by themselves. Yup. There is no face that is shown here to be doxed and there is also no private details involved such as our real name, last name and address. We are at the stadium and who goes with the stadium with a piece of paper with them? But, it would be hassle free if we can just follow what the OP has done but it will only be hard to do if you are alone and you only carry one cellphone with you.If someone just grabs the pic of other users, I think it can be the same as plagiarism and plagiarism is a serious offense in the forum but why will they do that? When they can just choose to not post here since no one is being forced here to do this at all.
